.definition: to turn a light, machine, etc. on by pressing a button or switch
.example: Switch on the video camera, please.

.definition: (of an aircraft) to leave the ground and fly
.example: When should we expect to take off?

.definition: to think of something such as an idea or a plan
.example: He will come up with a great idea for the ad campaign.

.definition: to share the same interests or have similar characteristics
.example: But these C.E.O.s have something in common.

.definition: to continues without stopping
.example: He could not keep up and dropped out of the race

.definition: do not know
.example: I have no idea what to do with my life.

.definition: to use an opportunity to achieve results, sometimes in an unfair way
.example: Let’s take advantage of the good weather and go to the beach.

.definition: the giving of control of or responsibility for something to someone else
.example: The responsibility was expected to be handed over.

.definition: before a particular time, or before doing a particular thing
.example: When you pay ahead (or in advance) you receive a discount

.definition: a subject or point open to controversy
.example: The book in question was published last year.

.definition: in the beginning
.example: Why didn't you tell me in the first place?

.definition: ready to participate; in agreement
.example: Before we agree to sign this contract with our new partner, we'd better make sure our president is on board.

.definition: don't have time for; don't want to
.example: Sorry, I can't afford to sit here and argue with you.

.definition: sometimes
.example: You can be really annoying at times, you know

.definition: following or obeying a rule, law, wish, etc.:
.example: In accordance with her wishes, she was buried in France

.definition: to ask someone to do something
.example: He decided to call on his members of staff for advice.

.definition: as much as possible or completely
.example: If you want to bring it up with the boss, I'll support you all the way.

.definition: in truth or in practical terms
.example: In effect it was like being in space.

.definition: something that is in someone's view
.example: I can’t stand the sight of it, to tell you the truth.

.definition: by or from (someone/ something)
.example: There are no barriers on the part of the government.

.definition: to talk about something
.example: Did you manage to bring up the holiday pay?

.definition: In order to do something
.example: She had put her hair up so as to look older

.definition: without actually doing something
.example: Short of calling the doctor, I don’t know what to do.

.definition: during, throughout these years
.example: She has over the years visited many cities.

.definition: used as a way of emphasizing a negative statement.
.example: It was by no means excellent but still better than last year.

.definition: barely do something or have ability to do something at all
.example: I could hardly wait for the weekend.

.definition: To show or provide evidence of having a particular trait, attribute, or characteristic.
.example: The bicycle proved to be of immense value.

.definition: used for saying something is not important.
.example: No matter what they say, it’s down to you now.

.definition: At the present moment; right now; currently
.example: At this point, we are the best ranked football team in the country.

.definition: when considered as the only thing.
.example: The car in itself wasn’t enough incentive.

.definition: denoting the first or first mentioned of two people or things.
.example: The former can actually require much more money.

.definition: used to express a wish, especially regretfully.
.example: If only I had listened to you.

.definition: in the future; still
.example: The best was yet to come.

.definition: to be the responsibility of someone
.example: It's up to the manager to make the final decision.

.definition: or anything similar
.example: Please help with donations of clothes, blankets or whatever you think might help.

.definition: because or as a result of
.example: In the light of the problems we're having, we have no choice but to close the business.

.definition: to introduce a situation that you are comparing with one that you have just mentioned, because there is a strong similarity between them.
.example: My parents are together and, if anything, closer than ever. In the same way, I also feel closer to both of them.

.definition: to a certain degree
.example: I don’t go out that much.

.definition: size and importance of problem or situation; degree to which something happens
.example: The extent to which the preceding can be asserted is largely dependent on what emerges in the study.

.definition: for a long period of time
.example: He’s actually been studying for some time now.

.definition: as a response, exchange, or reward for something.
.example: He leaves the house to his sister in return for her kindness.

.definition: a lot, very much
.example: The movie scared the kids to death.

.definition: on the basis, based on
.example: The decision was made on the grounds of safety.

.definition: An expression of dismay, concern, or worry; strongly suggesting disapproval.
.example: Oh dear, I’ve broken the lamp.

.definition: completely
.example: She paid in full.

.definition: Somewhat; partly; in a limited way or to a limited degree
.example: It is to some extent what is considered standard.

.definition: some unspecified type of thing or person
.example: What are you, some kind of genius?

.definition: having a larger number or amount than.
.example: Anything greater than five is fine.

.definition: to occur by accident or chance.
.example: I just happen to know that story.

.definition: believed an idea or opinion
.example: The congress held that it was acceptable.
